content: Morning Rohan. Just confirming tomorrow's mobile phlebotomist will arrive at your office at 9:00am sharp. All paperwork and kits are ready, nothing you need to prepare.
Perfect, thanks Ruby. Keeping it simple helps a lot.
Rohan, this week is a milestone. Your 6-month diagnostics mark the second big checkpoint. Proud of how consistently you've kept to the steady state these past weeks.
Thanks Neel. Honestly feels smoother now that I see how nutrition/sleep/cognition link up. Feels like less firefighting.
Blood draw all done ✅ Phlebotomist just left your office. Samples are already couriered to the lab on cold chain.
Smoothest one yet. Barely noticed it, appreciate the coordination 🙏
I’ll connect with Sarah this afternoon to slot in your VO₂ Max test and DEXA for next week. Those complete the 6-month panel picture.
Just spoke with Sarah — tentative hold for VO₂ Max on Wed morning and DEXA Thursday afternoon next week. She’ll block those in your diary.
Great, thanks for locking those in. Having them back-to-back makes sense.
Rohan, as results start to come in, remember we’re watching trends, not chasing perfection. Each panel is a data point on your multi-year trajectory.
That framing helps. Keeps me from obsessing over one number.
Quick Q, Warren. I’ve been reading about Lp(a). My last test was high-normal. Should we be tracking it more aggressively?

Good catch. Lp(a) is genetically driven — lifestyle doesn’t shift it much. What matters is trend + interaction with other risk factors. Yes, we’ll include it this round and keep it on your permanent panel.
Got it. Makes sense to keep it as a marker in the background then.
With your CAC score of 0 and MRI baseline, the next frontier is molecular. I recommend we add a liquid biopsy this cycle — it screens for circulating DNA signals from early cancers.
So if MRI is the hardware scan and CAC is plumbing, this biopsy is like a software scan — catching corrupted code early? Doing it now gives me a clean baseline?
Exactly 👌 That’s a perfect analogy. Establishing this baseline now lets us compare over time and gives you another layer of surveillance.
Then let’s do it. No reason to wait if it strengthens the net.
Already checked — the lab can run the liquid biopsy from yesterday’s blood draw. No extra appointment needed ✅
Brilliant. That’s exactly the kind of frictionless add-on I appreciate.
Rohan, your Garmin feed shows your HRV and resting HR stayed very stable leading into the draw. That’s the steady state we wanted — great adherence 👏
Nice. Honestly felt calmer too — probably thanks to sleep tightening up.
Noticed you logged less red meat last week. That tweak keeps your lipid profile lean for the panel. Small but compounding effect 👍
Yeah, switched a couple of lunches to fish. Was easier than I thought.
Quick reminder: keep some light mobility work going this week. Nothing heavy until after VO₂ Max — we want clean baselines for performance too.
Copy that. Sticking to stretching and a walk this evening.
Lab confirmed receipt of all samples, including liquid biopsy. Turnaround is 5–7 days. I’ll update once we have rolling results.
Thanks — good to know everything landed safely.
We’ll stage-release results as they’re ready. I suggest we review the lipid, inflammation, and glucose clusters first — those tell us immediate progress since Q1.
Makes sense. Start with the biggest levers first.
Sarah and I also penciled in a full debrief slot with Warren for Dec 5th, right after your DEXA. Calendar invite coming your way.
Good planning. That timing’s perfect.
Rohan, stepping back — 6 months in, you’ve stacked CAC=0, MRI, and now liquid biopsy. That’s three dimensions of assurance very few executives ever build.
Hearing it stacked like that really hits. Feels like the foundations are in place now.
Exactly — and from here it’s about rhythm, not sprints. We’ll keep everything light until VO₂ Max/Dexa next week. I’ll send your Monday brief as usual.
Sounds good Ruby. Appreciate how tightly this was run this week 👌
